diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with 24 hours of abdominal pain primarily in the right lower quadrant (RLQ), which increased in intensity, along with tenderness to palpation in the RLQ and positive psoas sign. CT imaging revealed mucosal thickening and hyperenhancement of the appendix, slight enlargement of the appendix measuring 10 mm, and a small amount of periependymal fluid, indicating acute appendicitis.
